title: When Potatoes Caused a Nation's Collapse
story: [dramatic] Believe it or not, the Great Potato Blight of 1845 devastated Ireland, killing over a million people! This fungal disease not only wiped out crops but also led to mass emigration. By 1850, Irish migrants transformed cities like Boston and New York, reshaping America’s landscape. Families torn apart, hunger running rampant, and desperation driving innovation—this blight didn’t just affect a nation; it changed the world! What if I told you it all hinged on one crop? Now that’s food for thought! [pause:1s]
description: One crop’s failure led to a million deaths and reshaped America. Discover the shocking truth behind the Great Potato Blight! #PotatoBlight #IrishFamine #History
